title: Senior SaaS Extensibility Consultant (Senior Consultant)
description: Senior SaaS Extensibility Consultant (Senior Consultant) RaiseMe     United States Posted   on May 7, 2025 Apply now About Ellucian Ellucian is a global market leader in education technology. We power innovation for higher education, partnering with more than 2,900 customers across 50 countries and serving over 20 million students. Ellucian's AI-powered platform, trained on the richest dataset available in higher education, drives efficiency, personalized experiences, and strengthened engagement for all students, faculty and staff. Fueled by decades of experience with a singular focus on the unique needs of learning institutions, the Ellucian platform features best-in-class SaaS capabilities and delivers insights needed now and into the future. These solutions and services span the entire student lifecycle, from student recruitment, enrollment, and retention to workforce analytics, fundraising, and alumni engagement. Ellucian's innovative solutions, vast ecosystem of partners, and user community of more than 45,000 provide best practices leading to greater institutional success and achieving better student outcomes.       Values Rooted in Purpose       We embrace the power to  lead , the courage to  innovate , and the determination to  grow . At our core, we believe in  humanizing  our approach, recognizing that our people are our greatest strength. With a shared vision of  transformation , we endeavor to shape a brighter future for higher education.   About the Opportunity As a  Senior SaaS Extensibility Consultant (Senior Consultant) , you will be responsible to provide a clear path in getting our customers integration projects live in their SaaS environment. This will include steps that cover identification, prioritization, and categorization of all of the Client’s integrations. This will include any integrations that you identify during their journey to get live in their SaaS environment. In addition, you will play the Ellucian brand ambassador role and suggest Ellucian Products that the client can leverage in case they are building the integrations. For the integration projects that our clients decide to develop, you will leverage your strong integration and architecture experience in clearing any roadblocks (for e.g. educating/assisting the Client on identifying Ellucian products, providing architectural support in these products if needed). You will use your soft skills to also liaison with various Ellucian teams or our partners to ensure they are on target to meet Client go live deadlines and work with the Project Manager to track the integrations progress to completion.   Where you will make an impact     Stay current with Ellucian applications.   Educate Clients on capabilities and usage of Ellucian’s SaaS Extensibility product toolset via Workshops or Zoom sessions.   Works effectively and individually with Technical and Functional teams to convert customer needs into business and technical requirements.   Works with various technical teams and project managers to aid in developing the overall project plan.   Document and maintain business requirements for Ellucian Extensibility projects.   Identify automation opportunities as needed.     What you will bring     Demonstrated experience in Oracle and Postgres database applications.   Demonstrated experience in web service development and integration patterns using REST, Request/Reply and Pub/Sub models.   Knowledge of Ellucian Intelligent Processes is a plus.   A minimum of three years of demonstrable experience in JavaScript, React and Node JS.   A minimum of seven years of technical experience working in a software development field.   Exhibits a strong sense of ownership for individual work assignments.   Strong communication and analytical skills with demonstrable presentation and professional communication skills (written and verbal).   Experience working independently with little direction to achieve team and project goals, as well as a desire and ability to work remotely in a team environment via phone or other electronic communication tools.   Possesses an established, effective method for tracking and completing tasks on time.   Experience working within a collaborative team-based work environment.   The successful candidate must be a disciplined self-starter, able to work on multiple projects concurrently, and must be able to meet or exceed deadlines for customer and internal deliverables.   The successful candidate must also be able to collaborate effectively and willingly and must be an engaged and interactive member of a large and very experienced team.   Proven ability to use appropriate skills in the areas of; project coordination, multi-tasking, prioritization of demands, conflict management, decision making tools & techniques, group discussion, training, facilitation, decision-making, communication, and time management.   Demonstrated experience in consulting and/or training and development; system implementation, and requirements gathering is beneficial.   Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills with demonstrably credibility and experience in the subject matter, as well as gravitas to influence senior client stakeholders at client site and industry events.   Proven ability to work independently or as part of a team.         What makes #Ellucianlife   Comprehensive health coverage: medical, dental, and vision    Flexible time off    Thrive Flex Lifestyle Account (LSA) that allows you to contribute towards your health, financial or learning interests   401k w/ match & BrightPlan - to help you save for the future   Parental Leave   5 charitable days to support the community that supports us   Telemedicine   Wellness   Headspace Care (mental health)       Wellbeats (virtual fitness classes)   RethinkCare & Wellthy– caregiver support   Diversity and inclusion programs which provide access to internal employee resource groups    Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team   We Foster a learning culture with:   Education Assistance Program    Professional development opportunities         #LI-PB1   #LI-remote Apply now See more open positions at  RaiseMe

title: Senior Design Engineer
description: Senior Design Engineer ELLO Design     San Francisco, CA, USA USD 180k-215k / year + Equity Posted   on May 24, 2025 Apply now   Engineering, full-time San Francisco (Relocation assistance available) Salary range mid-senior: $180,000 - $215,000 + Equity At Ello, our mission is to maximize the potential of all children. Our first product, Read with Ello, is an AI reading teacher that listens to children read out loud. Ello uses speech recognition to help them when they get stuck, makes up stories using generative AI, and inspires a love for reading. We’re now building on the success of Read with Ello and putting together the pieces of the world’s first complete AI teacher for all children. Together, we believe we can close the primary school education gap worldwide. Ello has been recognized on Fortune’s “Change the World” and Time’s 2024 Best Inventions lists. We are well-funded, backed by world-class investors, and ready to recruit new talent to help us achieve our vision. Who You’ll Be Joining Ello is a rapidly growing, series A startup focused on revolutionizing the way children learn and interact with technology. You will work directly with Ello’s Co-founder & CTO, Catalin Voss, on a small team (<10) of engineers, learning designers, and PMs to develop new products. You’ll be surrounded by a team of A+ engineers and you’ll work with some of the foremost experts in ML to productionize models and build new product experiences. We work in-person out of our San Francisco office and we’re big believers in face-to-face collaboration. About The Role We’re looking for a strong  Senior Design Engineer, New Products  to independently own the build-out of learning activities as part of Ello’s next-generation AI tutoring apps. You will bridge the gap between product development and engineering to own features from conception to playtest, at times acting as your own product manager, and at times collaborating closely with our product team. You’ll be part of a small team that is responsible for bringing Ello’s tutoring AI to life through agent control, character development, and game interactions. You pay attention to the details and thrive building products that delight users. You can work full-stack and across multiple programming languages, build chains, etc. Learning yet another language doesn’t feel like a daunting task at this point. You have experience with or a demonstrated curiosity for GenAI pipelines. On the backend, you’re able to write performant Python code and deal with complex I/O pipelines. On the frontend, you’re able to take an existing component library and build a rough UI from scratch (Flutter & React) without a designer or implement pixel-perfect layouts in collaboration with a designer. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds – mobile engineering, machine learning, or design & product – but we prioritize strong technical foundations and demonstrated execution speed in shipping. As an ideal candidate, you’ll have built and shipped software products end-to-end in the past, for example through an initiative you championed at a prior job, through an impressive side project, or as the founder of your own company. We’d love to hear about those in the interview process! Responsibilities   Own and build features end-to-end, from concept to delivery   Build agent-based AI pipelines, interfacing with ML engineers working on core models (e.g. our child speech recognition pipeline)   Serve as a bridge between product design and engineering, moving fluidly between UX/UI and technical problem-solving   Develop and integrate front-end components for mobile and web platforms, leveraging existing design systems and brand guidelines   Do whatever it takes to go from product conception to playtest       Required Experience   Engineering:     Excellent production-grade engineering & debugging skills across backend, ML, and mobile frontend   Experience with at least one of Flutter, native Android development in Java/Kotlin, or iOS development in Swift/ObjC   Experience with ML tooling and GenAI tools (you don’t need to be a linear algebra beast designing your own models, but you should understand how multimodal models work and communicate with ML engineers in their language)   Some experience with GenAI models & pipelines, including human eval infrastructure   Familiarity with Git flow, etc.    Basic data science skills (enough to analyze your own product insights)   Familiarity with basic infrastructure setup, continuous integration, and production release workflows           Design & Product:     Very high level of attention to detail. For example, you see how small changes in a character’s facial expression or the shading of a background affect the emotional impact of the end product   Demonstrated bias to action in product building: creating something from nothing and turning chaos into order   Demonstrated ability to work within existing design systems and brand standards to build new front-end components   Cross-functional skills; you likely either picked up engineering from a product/design domain or product skills from a computer science background   Familiarity with project management tools and collaborative development tools         Nice To Have Experience   Experience with game development   Experience as a product manager or in a role with significant ownership over features or components   Deep understanding of mobile app architecture, design patterns, and performance optimization techniques   Experience with designing products for children       We Look For Candidates Who   Have something to teach us   Want to do work they are proud of to ship products they are proud of   Have an urge to make a real impact on child development at scale   Take initiative and full ownership of their work   Prefer open and direct communication grounded in empathy to beating around the bush   Exemplify integrity in their actions, decisions, and communication   Want to build meaningful relationships at work       Here are some reasons to be a part of our team   Dive deep into the rapidly evolving world of AI and interactive learning.    Experience the joy of turning your designs and code into engaging and educational experiences for children worldwide   Be part of an A+ team and an engineering culture of excellence       About Ello Ello is a public benefit corporation on a mission to maximize the potential of all children. We’re currently around 45 people, headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in São Paulo, Brazil; Nairobi, Kenya; and New York. Our team has deep expertise in artificial intelligence, K-12 education, and child development across institutions such as Stanford, Berkeley, Google, Apple, and more. We were part of Y Combinator’s W20 batch and are funded by world-class investors including Goodwater Capital, Homebrew, Reed Hastings, Common Sense Growth, Ravensburger, Project A Ventures, Reach Capital, Khosla Ventures, WndrCo, Visible Ventures, and K9 Ventures. We’re a small, collaborative team that takes each other’s voices very seriously. Because our mission is to support all children, it is critical that our team is representative of the communities we work in; we place significant emphasis on ensuring diversity in our team and inclusion in our culture. We feel enormously privileged to be one of the few companies that has the opportunity to take a shot at truly revolutionizing education with AI at this inflection point in technology. We don’t take it for granted, so we work quite hard to turn that vision into reality with urgency. We want to create an environment in which we can all be our best selves, use our strengths to take Ello forward, and develop our own skills. We want to have fun while working hard to do impactful things that we’re proud of – and we believe it’s possible to do both. At Ello, we view diversity as a moral imperative and a competitive advantage. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, skin color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We plan and structure our interviews to directly assess skills and experience. If you need any accommodations throughout the interview process, please reach out to  recruiting@ello.com Compensation Range: $180K - $215K   Apply now See more open positions at  ELLO

title: Tech Lead, GenAI & Machine Learning
description: Tech Lead, GenAI & Machine Learning ELLO Software Engineering     San Francisco, CA, USA USD 165k-220k / year + Equity Posted   on May 24, 2025 Apply now   Engineering, Full-Time San Francisco, CA Salary range: $165,000 - $220,000 + Equity At Ello, our mission is to maximize the potential of all children. Our first product, Read with Ello, is an AI reading teacher that listens to children read out loud. Ello uses speech recognition to help them when they get stuck, makes up stories using generative AI, and inspires a love for reading. We’re now building on the success of Read with Ello and putting together the pieces of the world’s first complete AI teacher for all children. Together, we believe we can close the primary school education gap worldwide. Ello has been recognized on Fortune’s “Change the World” and Time’s 2024 Best Inventions lists. We are well-funded, backed by world-class investors, and ready to recruit new talent to help us achieve our vision. Who You’ll Be Joining Ello’s 5-person Machine Learning team includes some of the world’s foremost experts in their areas. To give one example, our speech perception efforts are led by the co-authors of wav2vec. At Ello, they’ve built the world’s best child speech recognition system, beating Whisper. That ability to understand child speech reliably enables us to unlock the power of generative AI tools for early childhood learning. We work on a broad range of machine learning problems across multimodal machine learning, NLP, image generation, and speech perception. We collaborate closely with advisors from Stanford and top industry research labs (on a weekly basis, not in some hands-off way). We work in-person out of our San Francisco office and we’re big believers in face-to-face collaboration. About The Role As the Tech Lead on the ML team, you will work closely with the Co-Founder & CTO to lead the architecture design for all our ML and GenAI efforts. You will be successful in this role if you have a strong foundational understanding of AI models but ultimately care deeply about turning research outputs into magical real-world product experiences. Most importantly, you are excited about the opportunity to make a real impact on child development at scale. Your role will bridge AI application development with third-party models and internal ML development leveraging our proprietary models and data.   Machine learning: You should have foundational knowledge in ML. You will oversee MLops in collaboration with our Platform team and set good standards for your colleagues on critical design questions around dataset management, experiment tracking, and distributed training infrastructure. You will also get into the weeds as an IC and implement state-of-the-art machine learning systems.    AI Applications: You will lead the charge on bringing best practices to our AI-first product development process. You’ll scale our evaluation infrastructure for applications spanning complex use cases – reading instruction, story generation, and interactive dialogue-based teaching. You’ll design clean programming interfaces and build an internal SDK for our product engineering team.        Responsibilities   Oversee the development and deployment of machine learning models to production environments   Lead by example, fostering a culture of excellence in architecture, coding, and model development    Provide guidance, regular feedback, education, and mentoring to other members of the ML team   Monitor and maintain deployed models and data pipelines   Independently lead research work streams as part of Ello’s ML team   Lead collaboration with platform and frontend engineers as well as TPM and data team on data collection, pipeline design, model training, and deployment   Continuously learn and stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning engineering       Required Experience   5+ years of experience as an ML engineer/researcher working with modern Machine Learning toolkits (Python stack, very comfortable with PyTorch)   2+ years of experience with GenAI product development (pipeline design, serving, prompt management, fine-tuning, evaluation, etc.), with some evidence shipping real world products using the most recent tools   3+ years of experience building, scaling, and optimizing ML systems   Experience setting up ML ops workflows and infrastructure from scratch in a startup environment (ideally in Terraform on AWS)   Production programming experience on a data-intensive project in distributed infrastructure   Experience deploying distributed data and training pipelines on Kubernetes   Experience with large language models   Experience writing high-performance, parallelized code   Applied mathematics and linear algebra proficiency at the level at which you can contribute to research discussions with a deeply technical team   Very accustomed to agile software engineering processes, git flow, etc.        Nice To Have Experience   Experience with voice AI stacks and audio pipeline development   Prior experience setting up GPU clusters (e.g. previously set up SLURM, or built multi-cloud model training pipelines with Infrastructure-as-Code)   Some familiarity with basic full-stack web development workflows and frontend API interaction   2+ years of experience leading teams developing ML solutions   On-device systems experience     An understanding of low-level build pipelines and deployment experience in C/C++ or similar   Experience working with mobile operating systems and I/O pipelines in resource-constrained environments   Experience with optimizing neural networks to perform well on low-power mobile platforms (e.g. pruning, distillation, quantization)     Signal processing background       We Look For Candidates Who   Have something to teach us   Want to do work they are proud of to ship products they are proud of   Have an urge to make a real impact on child development at scale   Take initiative and full ownership of their work   Prefer open and direct communication grounded in empathy to beating around the bush   Exemplify integrity in their actions, decisions, and communication   Want to build meaningful relationships at work       Here are some reasons to be a part of our team   Help lead a small but rapidly growing team of A+ engineers in a well-funded company   Work at the cutting edge of interactive learning and artificial intelligence   Stay plugged in with the research community while building real-world products   Do meaningful work supporting child development that you can witness firsthand during in-office playtests. Make an edit in your jupyter notebook this week, deploy it on-device in C++ next week, and watch it bring smiles to kids’ faces a day later       A note on immigration We don’t shy away from sponsoring US visas and green card petitions. Our CTO and CEO have each gone through their own immigration journeys and are familiar with the challenges. We have successfully secured O-1 visas, H-1B transfers, etc. for Ello employees and retain top immigration counsel. About Ello Ello is a public benefit corporation on a mission to maximize the potential of all children. We’re currently around 45 people, headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in São Paulo, Brazil; Nairobi, Kenya; and New York. Our team has deep expertise in artificial intelligence, K-12 education, and child development across institutions such as Stanford, Berkeley, Google, Apple, and more. We were part of Y Combinator’s W20 batch and are funded by world-class investors including Goodwater Capital, Homebrew, Reed Hastings, Common Sense Growth, Ravensburger, Project A Ventures, Reach Capital, Khosla Ventures, WndrCo, Visible Ventures, and K9 Ventures. We’re a small, collaborative team that takes each other’s voices very seriously. Because our mission is to support all children, it is critical that our team is representative of the communities we work in; we place significant emphasis on ensuring diversity in our team and inclusion in our culture. We feel enormously privileged to be one of the few companies that has the opportunity to take a shot at truly revolutionizing education with AI at this inflection point in technology. We don’t take it for granted, so we work quite hard to turn that vision into reality with urgency. We want to create an environment in which we can all be our best selves, use our strengths to take Ello forward, and develop our own skills. We want to have fun while working hard to do impactful things that we’re proud of – and we believe it’s possible to do both. At Ello, we view diversity as a moral imperative and a competitive advantage. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, skin color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We plan and structure our interviews to directly assess skills and experience. If you need any accommodations throughout the interview process, please reach out to  recruiting@ello.com Compensation Range: $165K - $220K   Apply now See more open positions at  ELLO

title: Associate, Finance
description: Associate, Finance New Profit Inc. Accounting & Finance     United States · Boston, MA, USA USD 72,074-78,826 / year Posted   on Jun 19, 2025 Apply now     ABOUT NEW PROFIT New Profit is a venture philanthropy organization that catalyzes the impact of social entrepreneurs who are expanding access and opportunity in America. We provide capital, capacity, and community to a portfolio of organizations to increase their impact, scale, and sustainability. And we partner with social entrepreneurs, philanthropists, and cross-sector leaders to shift how the philanthropic sector pursues social change and ensures that everyone in America can thrive. Since 1998, New Profit has invested over $350M in 275+ high-impact organizations serving more than 35 million people in all 50 states.      Learn more at  www.newprofit.org .      TEAM OVERVIEW - FINANCE The Finance team is a core function within New Profit, playing a vital role in managing the organization’s financial health and supporting sustainable growth. This team is responsible for a wide range of key activities, including financial planning and budgeting, accounting and record-keeping, financial reporting and analysis, and cash flow management.     Over the years, the Finance team has grown in both its operations and execution, consistently delivering on the critical elements that underpin our financial strategy. As we continue to evolve, this department remains central to ushering New Profit into the future—adapting our operations and structure to meet the changing needs of the organization and our mission.   POSITION OVERVIEW Are you detail-oriented, organized, and eager to grow your career in nonprofit finance? We’re looking for a Finance Associate to join our mission-driven team and help ensure the financial operations of our organization run smoothly and efficiently. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a foundation in accounting or finance who wants to build their skills in a collaborative, purpose-driven environment.   If so, New Profit wants to talk to you about an exciting opportunity to join our Finance team. The Finance Associate plays a key role in coordinating and managing New Profit’s organizational systems including finance, accounting, and payroll. This role is an excellent opportunity to gain valuable experience and build skills in finance, accounting, human resources, and other functional areas that are based on best practices applicable to any organization.   WHAT YOU WILL DO   Financial Management:     Process accounts payable and manage resolution of billing issues   Process and deposit receivables   Create wires for disbursement and transfers between New Profit bank accounts   Help maintain complete files to support all accounting and finance activities, including vendor activity and contract billing   Work closely with the entire New Profit team to ensure timely and accurate financial records & reporting     Human Resources and Payroll Administration:     Onboard new hires into payroll, benefits, and systems   Process new hire and employee termination paperwork   Create biweekly payroll   Manage and process staff expense reimbursements   Serve as resource to staff as needed     New Profit Expectation as a Team Member   In addition, we expect all New Profit staff to embody our core values and our competency model. We are committed to the work that we do in supporting our Social Entrepreneurs and supporting one another to create an environment that helps us to thrive. We are a team and everyone has a responsibility to support, care for, and uplift their fellow team members. QUALIFICATIONS     You have a Certificate in Accounting, or Associate’s/Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field   You have some professional work experience (internships, administrative roles, or other office-based work experience welcome); direct finance experience is a plus but not required.   You have an intermediate command of Microsoft EXCEL   You have superior organizational skills combined with an obsessive attention to detail   You can work independently and with remote team members   You have a high level of interpersonal maturity, poise, and professionalism   You have excellent judgment in handling sensitive and confidential information   You have unwavering commitment to service and a strong customer orientation   You have excellent verbal and written communication skills   You embody and demonstrate your commitment to New Profit’s mission, social entrepreneurship, and social change      SALARY The salary range for the Associate position will be $72,074 - $78,826 annually, with the exact salary depending on prior work experience and the assessment of one's fit for the role. Additionally, New Profit provides a suite of competitive benefits including health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, retirement benefits, and a generous PTO policy with an end-of-year holiday break.   HOW TO APPLY To apply for this position, please go to  New Profit’s Career page . Please submit a thoughtful cover letter and resume addressed to Brent Locke.   New Profit is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic as established by federal, state, or local laws. We are committed to providing a workplace free from discrimination or harassment, and take responsibility for always striving to create an environment that makes every employee and candidate feel welcome.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.   Please no phone calls or direct emails.     Apply now See more open positions at  New Profit Inc.

title: Senior IT Systems Engineer
description: The role: Newsela is looking for a Senior IT Systems Engineer/Senior IT Systems Administrator to join our Information Technology team. Reporting to the IT Engineering Lead, you will help manage, scale, and automate our infrastructure. You will administer and support identity and access controls for corporate applications; automate administrative processes; partner with business stakeholders to translate real-world processes into structured, repeatable workflows; and back up our support and systems staff with engineering leadership. On-call requirements are occasional but typically can be resolved from a mobile device as our infrastructure is 100% cloud. Why you’ll love this role: System Administration Maintain and configure core SaaS systems and internal tools, ensuring stability, security, and scalability across applications like Atlassian Suite, Netsuite, Google Workspace, Kandji, and Slack. Asset & Configuration Management Maintain accurate records of employees, devices, vendors, and applications using Jira Assets. Ensure these systems stay in sync with authoritative data sources like the HRIS and device management platforms. Integration Platform Management Operate and improve data flows and business logic using Celigo, ensuring systems talk to each other reliably and in real-time. Compliance Support & Observability Support compliance efforts (e.g., SOC 2) by configuring tools like Vanta, ensuring key IT workflows (onboarding, offboarding, access audits) meet SLA and documentation requirements. Build alerts and reports to monitor critical workflows. Why you’re a great fit: You’ve spent at least 3-5 years in an IT, systems, or infrastructure-focused role—titles may vary (System Administrator, IT Engineer, Business Systems Analyst, etc.). You’re comfortable managing SaaS systems, automating workflows, and solving messy access or integration problems. You have a bias for automation and care about clean documentation. You have hands-on experience and ability to understand, communicate, and improve technical workflows. Experience in tech, startups, or SaaS environments is helpful, but not required. If you’ve worked closely with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders, that’s a big plus. Must have a background with Google Workspace, Slack, Kandji, Atlassian, Jira Service Management, Jira Assets, Celigo, or another integration platform (Workato, Zapier, etc.), SAML/SSO concepts, Okta, Vanta or other compliance platforms, light scripting (e.g., Bash, Python, API calls) Why you’ll love working at Newsela: Health & Wellness: Access to the world’s leading medical experts for healthcare (pets included!). Discounts and resources to stay healthy: mind, body, and soul. Work From Home: Almost all of our roles are fully remote - tech stipend included! Supporting ALL Families: Supplemental programs and time off to take care of your family and yourself. Time Off: Flexible PTO to recharge, including Sabbatical Leave Inclusive Experiences: Robust DEIB curriculum, Identity & Experience Groups (Affinity Groups + Employee Resource Group), Authentic & Transparent conversations with Executive Leadership Teams, and integration of DEIB lens across Talent lifecycle processes. Professional Development: Holistic Learning & Development Programs that enable meaningful & inclusive experiences, programs that build future-focused competencies, cohort & community learning sessions that foster a sense of belonging, and individual development plans aligned with your personal and professional aspirations to turn goals into reality. Make A Difference: No matter your role or department, the work you do each day helps share the future of education and improves the lives of students and teachers. About Newsela: Newsela takes authentic, real world content from trusted sources and makes it instruction ready for K-12 classrooms. Each text is published at five reading levels, so content is accessible to every learner. Today, over 3.3 million teachers and 40 million students have registered with Newsela for content that's personalized to student interests, accessible to everyone, aligned to instructional standards, and attached to activities and reporting that hold teachers accountable for instruction and students accountable for their work. With over 15,000 texts on our platform and multiple new texts published every day across 20+ genres, Newsela enables educators to go deep on any subject they choose. Compensation: Base salary: $100,000 - $112,000 per year. Total compensation for this role also includes incentive stock options and benefits. #LI-Remote

title: Sales Manager, K12 (Mid-Market & Enterprise)
description: The Role: We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Sales Manager to lead and inspire a team of Mid-Market and Enterprise Account Executives focused on the K12 education market. The ideal candidate will be a results-oriented leader with a proven track record of exceeding sales targets, building high-performing teams, and driving strategic growth within complex sales cycles. This role requires a deep understanding of the K12 landscape, exceptional coaching abilities, and a commitment to fostering a positive, people-first sales culture. Pipeline Generation & Management: Drive the team to proactively build and maintain a robust sales pipeline, ensuring a minimum of 2.5x pipeline to quota coverage at all times. Strategic Deal Coaching: Conduct regular pipeline reviews and provide in-depth coaching to the team through deal reviews, leveraging methodologies like MEDDPICC and insights from sales enablement tools such as Gong. Recruitment & Onboarding: Actively participate in the recruitment, interviewing, and onboarding of new sales talent to expand and strengthen the team. Market Feedback: Serve as a conduit for market and customer feedback to product and marketing teams to inform future product development and go-to-market strategies. CRM Management: Ensure consistent and accurate usage of CRM (e.g., Salesforce) for pipeline management, forecasting, and activity tracking. Sales Leadership Experience: Minimum of 2+ years of experience leading a sales team, with a proven track record of managing teams to a collective quota of $5M+ annually. Enterprise Sales Experience: Minimum of 4+ years of experience selling and/or leading teams to sell into large Enterprise accounts (e.g., school districts with 20,000+ students or complex state-level deals). Sales Methodology Proficiency: Demonstrated proficiency in sales methodologies such as MEDDPICC, Challenger Sale, or similar structured approaches. Leadership & Coaching Skills: Exceptional leadership, coaching, and mentoring abilities, with a passion for developing sales professionals. Communication Skills: Superior verbal and written communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Analytical & Forecasting Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret sales data, forecast accurately, and make data-driven decisions. CRM Proficiency: Proficient in using CRM software (e.g., Salesforce) and other sales enablement tools (e.g., Gong, Salesloft). Procurement Knowledge: Understanding of K12 procurement processes, funding cycles, and decision-making structures. Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Education, or a related field; or equivalent practical experience. Preferred Qualifications Experience selling SaaS solutions into the K12 market. Proven ability to navigate complex sales cycles with multiple stakeholders. Familiarity with EdTech industry trends and competitive landscape. Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. title: Summer STEM & SEL Facilitator
description: Summer STEM & SEL Facilitator Eight Million Stories     Houston, TX, USA USD 15-21 / hour Posted   on Jun 7, 2025 Apply now Job Title:  Summer STEM & SEL Facilitator    Program:  Eight Million Stories STEM Camp (Grades K–7)    Location:  5999 Savoy Dr, Houston, TX 77036 (in partnership with the Academy for Accelerated Learning)    Dates: July 7 – July 31, 2025    Schedule:  Monday–Thursday, 8:00 AM – 2:00 PM    Pay Range:  $15–$21/hour    Day/Hours : Monday-Thursday – 8:00am-3:00pm    About Us:    Eight Million Stories (8MS) transforms the lives of at-promise youth and young adults (ages 9–24) through education, employment, and personal development. We equip youth with the tools they need to thrive through holistic services and programming grounded in empowerment, equity, and impact.    This summer, in partnership with the Academy for Accelerated Learning, we are offering a dynamic STEM Camp for students in grades K–7. The camp will combine hands-on STEM learning with Social Emotional Learning (SEL) activities to spark curiosity, build confidence, and foster personal growth.    Position Overview:    We are seeking engaging, mission-aligned individuals to serve as classroom Instructors for our Summer STEM Camp. This is an ideal opportunity for current educators or college students who are passionate about working with youth and creating fun, enriching learning experiences rooted in STEM and SEL.     Key Responsibilities:    Instructional Support    •  Facilitate and support daily STEM activities and hands-on learning stations for elementary and middle school students.    •  Lead or assist with age-appropriate SEL instruction and community-building exercises.  •  Create an inclusive, energetic, and student-centered classroom environment.    Mentorship & Youth Engagement   •  Serve as a positive role model for students, building trust and encouraging curiosity and collaboration.    •  Foster a culture of respect, responsibility, and engagement.    Safety & Structure    •  Ensure student safety and a structured environment during camp hours.    •  Support attendance tracking, classroom routines, and behavior expectations.    Collaboration    •  Work closely with fellow instructors, program staff, and site partners to ensure smooth day-to day operations.    •  Contribute ideas and feedback to strengthen the camp experience for students.     Qualifications:    •  Passion for working with youth and creating supportive, engaging learning spaces.    •  Experience working with children or students in educational or enrichment settings.     •  Interest in or background in STEM subjects and/or Social Emotional Learning.    •  Strong communication and classroom management skills.    •  Current educators, education majors, or college students are strongly encouraged to apply.    •  Must pass a background check .    How to Apply:    Submit your resume and a brief statement of interest highlighting your experience working with youth and why you’re interested in supporting our STEM and SEL-focused camp. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Send resumes to:  info@eightmillionstories.org    Why Join Us:    This is more than a summer opportunity, it's a chance to make a meaningful impact on the lives of young learners. Join Eight Million Stories in empowering the next generation of innovators, leaders, and learners through creativity, connection, and hands-on education. title: Staff Accountant
description: The role: The Staff Accountant is responsible for performing tasks that will help us monitor our revenues. The Staff Accountant will be responsible for keeping track of money owed to us by customers, preparing invoices and updating records to ensure that we receive payment for services offered to clients. In addition, the Staff Accountant will support the month-end accounting close process including preparing journal entries, reconciling accounts, and assisting in the preparation of financial statements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies. The goal is to contribute to the accurate preparation of invoices, accounts receivable management, and safeguard the company’s income. Why you’ll love this role: Process client invoices and e nsure invoices are free of errors and processed in a timely manner Assist billing team with discrepancies on invoices Reconcile general ledger accounts, including cash and accounts receivable Prepare and post journal entries to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting. Ensure compliance with internal controls and accounting policies. Respond to customer inquiries and resolves issues as needed Keep accurate records in our system and makes updates to customer info as needed Reconcile deal information in our Billing System with signed customer agreement Follow up with delinquent accounts, make collection calls, draft collection emails and letters Provide A/R write-offs and c ommunicate with clients with efficiency, professionalism and provide excellent customer service Why you’re a great fit: 2+ years of related accounting experience required Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Accounting required Excellent verbal and written communication skills Great at math and proficient in Excel Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced environment Ability to anticipate work needs and interact professionally with customers Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail Experience in a SaaS industry with recurring revenue preferred Proficiency in accounting software programs, such as Netsuite, is preferred Compensation: Base salary: $60,000 - $67,000 Total compensation for this role also incentive stock options and benefits. About Newsela: One of the fastest growing tech companies in K-12 education, Newsela was founded on the principle that while every child may have unique learning preferences, they all deserve a rich learning experience that ignites a love of learning. We built our platform based on learning science research to deliver the most engaging, authentic content to modernize how teaching happens in the classroom. Along with interactive assessments and tools, we provide teachers with digital content at five reading levels -- from +100 of the best sources -- that is relevant to the diverse backgrounds and interests of their students. Since we started in 2013, we’ve established a presence in 90% of U.S. K-12 schools and over 2.5M teachers and 37M students have registered with Newsela. Disclaimer: Please be aware of recruitment phishing scams affecting Newsela and other employers. Newsela does not use third party services for full time hires. Our recruiting emails will come from an @newsela.com email address. You can reach out to jobs@newsela.com if you have concerns about the legitimacy of an email sent by or on behalf of Newsela’s talent acquisition team. Newsela will never ask for financial or banking information from candidates, nor will you be asked for any type of payment as part of consideration for employment with Newsela.

title: Southeast Regional Program Director
description: Southeast Regional Program Director America on Tech Operations     Connecticut, USA · United States USD 70k-75k / year Posted   on Jun 5, 2025 Apply now   Position Title:  Southeast Regional Program Director   Position Type:  Full-time, Hybrid    Location:  Atlanta, Georgia   Start:  June 2025   Salary:  $70,000 - $75,000       About America On Tech:    America On Tech (AOT) is a national nonprofit preparing the next generation of technology leaders from underestimated communities. Since 2014, AOT has provided no-cost tech education and workforce training to students in NYC, LA, Miami, and Atlanta. AOT equips young people with in-demand skills in AI, Web Development, Data Science, and more, creating pathways to higher education and careers.       To date, AOT has served 5,300+ students, facilitated 1,000+ paid internships generating $4.1M in wages, and distributed $2.4M in stipends. AOT alumni are twice as likely to attend college and five times more likely to pursue tech degrees. Learn more at  www.americaontech.org .       Who We Are Looking For:    AOT is seeking a mission-driven and entrepreneurial Southeast Regional Program Director to lead the strategic growth and implementation of our high school programs in the Southeast. Based in Atlanta, this individual will oversee the regional expansion of AOT’s programming into Georgia while also managing the continued success of our program in Miami.       The ideal candidate is energized by building new initiatives, passionate about youth development and equity in tech, and confident in both launching local programs and managing remote team members. In the first year of expansion, this individual will directly manage student cohorts and facilitate programming while helping establish and grow school and community partnerships. Over time, the Regional Program Director will grow the regional team and infrastructure, driving AOT’s mission throughout the Southeast.       The Southeast Regional Program Director will report to the National Director of High School Programs who is based in Miami.        Essential Duties and Responsibilities:       Program Management & Delivery (Atlanta Focus)       Lead the execution of AOT’s TECH360 and Tech Flex Leaders programs in Atlanta to ensure high-quality, mission-aligned delivery.       Facilitate program sessions and events (ongoing) and manage student cohorts (during the first year of programs) to ensure strong student experiences and outcomes.       Manage all logistics related to in-person and hybrid programming including schedules, venues, technology, and volunteers.       Oversee student enrollment, retention, and engagement targets.       Develop a positive learning environment and manage student success strategies in collaboration with instructors and peer mentors.       Act as primary point of contact for Atlanta-based student cohorts and stakeholders.           Team Management (Regional Scope)       Provide remote management and coaching for the Program Manager in Miami, ensuring program quality and alignment with national goals.       Support team development through regular check-ins, clear goal-setting, and collaborative problem-solving.       Help standardize practices and build cross-site collaboration between Southeast locations.           Regional Expansion & Strategy       Work closely with the National Director of High School Programs and VP of Programs to develop and execute the Atlanta expansion strategy.       Conduct landscape scans, build community relationships, and represent AOT at local events and partnerships.       Offer on-the-ground insights to help shape scalable, sustainable programming across the region.       Serve as a local ambassador for AOT, raising visibility and strengthening our regional network.           Program Evaluation & Reporting       Track regional program metrics and outcomes to support evaluation and decision-making.       Analyze student progress, participation, and satisfaction data to recommend improvements.       Provide regular updates to national leadership with highlights, learnings, and KPIs.       Cross-Functional Collaboration       Contribute to national team conversations around curriculum, tech tools, and best practices.       Share insights from the Southeast region to improve AOT’s programming across all sites.           Qualifications:       Required:       Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in education, nonprofit management, or a related field.       4-6 years of experience in program management, youth development, or education, including experience managing people or remote teams.       Experience working with high school students, ideally in underrepresented communities.       Skilled at managing hybrid and in-person programming with strong attention to logistics and detail.       Confident facilitator, able to lead program sessions and build rapport with students.       Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.       Comfort managing remote staff and navigating cross-site collaboration.       Proficient in digital tools including Google Workspace, Zoom, and CRM systems (Salesforce a plus). title: Contractor: Sales Development Representative
description: Seeking to hire a Contractor based out of Mexico, Costa Rica, or Columbia for Sales Development Representative (SDR) services. As a contractor, this role will work across Newsela’s Sales organization to support growth by researching, prospecting and qualifying leads in order to build pipeline for Sales Reps. Scope of Services: Provide prospecting through calls and emails Qualifying leads in order to build pipeline for Sales Reps Respond to inbound sales inquiries Provide proactive cold outreach to potential new customers Provide online product demonstrations that draw prospects into initial discovery calls and identify key needs that ultimately lead to qualified opportunities for our Sales team Collaborate within the Sales organization to inform strategy and process that enhances sales performance by providing feedback on market feedback and trends Act as the initial point of contact with prospects Skills & Experience: Fluent in English 1+ year of lead generation or inside sales experience Your pipeline generation experience includes engaging prospects through email and  phone conversations that lead to qualified meetings Salesforce.com experience and sales process training to tactfully manage a pipeline to meet and exceed team goals You are familiar with sales platforms such as Salesloft, Outreach.io, or Yesware You are an excellent communicator who can truly empathize with the challenges our different buyers face You’re able to establish clear value propositions that connect buyer/user needs to the product and services we offer You thrive in a fast-paced environment and use your creativity when partnering with team members to ensure flawless execution Please note that given the nature of the contract, this role will not be eligible to participate in company-sponsored benefits. #LI-Remote

title: Contractor: AI Automation Lead
description: Seeking to hire a Contractor based out of Argentina or Mexico for AI Automation Lead services About: Newsela is seeking a highly driven and technically fluent AI Automation Lead based in LATAM to help us streamline and scale our Sales and Customer Success operations using AI. In this hybrid role, you’ll act as both prompt engineer and AI product owner — identifying high-impact automation opportunities, building them using Gemini + Google Workspace and other AI tools, and deploying solutions that save our GTM teams time and money. Scope of Services: Report into Revenue Operations and work cross-functionally with Sales, Customer Success, Data, and Marketing teams to help Newsela reduce costs and increase GTM productivity through practical AI Identify and prioritize CS and Sales workflows that can be automated with AI (e.g. individual customer analysis, email outreach and follow up, lead generation and qualification) Design and build prompt-driven tools using Gemini, Google Sheets, Docs, Gmail, and Slides to build reusable templates, prompt libraries, and internal documentation. title: Multimedia Producer
description: About the role: Newsela and Generation Genius are launching a bold new animated video series, and we’re looking for a versatile, hands-on Multimedia Producer to join us at the ground floor. As our first full-time multimedia team member , you’ll play a key role in shaping the creative and production processes that will define this new studio effort. You’ll collaborate closely with the Director of Multimedia to bring our educational vision to life, handling everything from post-production to light animation, audio and video shoot direction, and freelancer coordination. This is a unique opportunity for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, startup-like environment within an established and mission-driven company. Why you'll love the role: Video Editing : Cut and assemble video content from scratch, combining live action, animation, stock, VO, and music to deliver highly engaging, polished videos for classroom use. Basic Animation & Motion Graphics : Create light animation, kinetic text, and visual effects using tools like After Effects. Graphic Design Support : Edit and format assets in Photoshop and Illustrator, including thumbnails, title cards, storyboards, style frames, and other visual collateral. Shoot Direction & Support : Assist in planning, directing, and capturing professional video and audio sessions (VO, talent shoots, interviews, music recording). Project Management : Help manage production timelines, coordinate with freelance editors, illustrators, and animators, and track assets through delivery. Creative Collaboration : Work closely with writers, musicians, illustrators, and internal subject matter experts to align visuals with educational goals and brand tone. Studio Building : Support the development of workflows, asset libraries, studio gear selection, and onboarding new collaborators as the team grows. Who we're looking for: A creative problem-solver with strong editing chops and a passion for visual storytelling. A multimedia generalist who’s comfortable jumping between video, animation, design, and production planning. A great communicator and collaborator who can work closely with artists, educators, and producers—and provide clear feedback to freelancers. Comfortable both on set and in the edit bay , with a strong sense of pacing, visual flow, and audience needs (especially K–12 learners). Organized and proactive , with strong attention to detail and ability to manage shifting priorities. Why you're a great fit: 3–6 years of experience in multimedia production (video editing, basic animation, content creation) You have experience in educational media, children’s content, or animation pipelines You are proficient in Adobe Creative Cloud, especially Premiere, After Effects, and Photoshop You are familiar with audio direction and video production workflows You have strong organizational and communication skills Preferred: You have experience working with or managing freelancers While this role is primarily remote, there is a preference for candidates based in or around NYC Base compensation: $88,700 - $90,000 Total compensation for this role also includes incentive stock options and benefits. This compensation range may be adjusted based on actual experience.

title: Lead Research & Development Strategist (P2188)

We help The Kroger Co., consumer packaged goods companies, agencies, publishers and affiliates create more personalized and valuable experiences for shoppers across the path to purchase. Join us at 84.51°! __________________________________________________________ Lead Research and Development Strategist (G3) P2188 LOCATION: Chicago or Cincinnati SUMMARY : The Lead Research and Development Strategist plays a pivotal role in driving business-focused innovation and validating research through a business lens. This position is essential for ensuring the LABS’s innovation pipeline continues to deliver significant returns by generating tangible business value and focusing on opportunities for strategic transformation. The role involves combination of project management, business development, and relationship building with stakeholders, fostering an environment where innovation thrives, and strategic transformation is realized. In close partnership with LABS leadership and with key stakeholders, the Lead Strategist identifies high-impact research areas that align with business needs and explores how disruptive sciences and technology can drive value across various domains. Subsequently, Lead strategist leads LABS’ R&D teams in demonstrating technical feasibility and potential for generating business value via creation of functional prototypes and conducting in-market testing. RESPONSIBILITIES : Drive discovery sessions to uncover high-risk, high-reward problem statements and engage with key stakeholders to understand challenges and explore how disruptive sciences can drive value. Lead research and development by collaborating with LABS’ R&D teams to create functional prototypes and conduct in-market testing that demonstrates technical feasibility and potential for generating business value. Translates business desires/requirements into effective research and development initiatives Lead and manage projects, tasks, and stakeholders to ensure that projects are delivered on time. Work with LABS LT to ensure sufficient resource allocation Coordinate regular project check-ins to ensure stakeholders and team members are on the same page and there is sufficient communication and understanding of all project aspects Think creatively when building analytics solutions to bring the most value to the user, balancing transformation ability of the research and practicality. Help LABS Lead continuously evaluate research portfolio against the backlog and emerging opportunities. Develop stakeholder connection and conduct discovery sessions for prioritized initiatives. Help with value estimation in early phase research. Keep a pulse on emerging technology areas. Identify high-risk-high-reward opportunities areas that are transformational to the business, either through market research or stakeholder engagement. Deep understanding of the business domain, stakeholders, business processes and constraints in which your product(s) play Deep understanding of customers/users problems, how they think and operate and the platforms/technology they use Understand and communicate organization objectives, strategies and solution needs to the team to facilitate results (where collaborative/as colleague) Manage and communicate dependencies and risks. This may include drafting memos, talking points, briefings, strategic communications, and other materials as needed QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE : Stakeholder management – experienced in building and managing stakeholder relationships to influence and drive change Skilled in working with cross-functional data science development teams (scientists and technologists with diverse skillsets) in an agile environment Experience defining goals, user stories, and prioritizing machine learning and artificial intelligence solutions Experience gathering user requirements for data science solutions Experience building and delivering sophisticated systems that leverage various machine learning algorithms or technologies that integrate well with other organization-wide systems and are able to scale optimally. Experience in designing, developing, and launching ML/ AI solutions that become widely adopted across the enterprise. Skilled in managing business priorities against design/user needs while delivering against product roadmaps Stakeholder management skills – experienced in building and managing stakeholder relationships to influence and drive change Problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills Planning, organizational and time management skills Comfort with ambiguity – remains confident, positive and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and unexpected results; recovers quickly from setbacks Exhibits qualities of and have proven to be a great teammate Verbal and written communication skills, ability to translate between business and technical Technical acumen – grasps the technical details of data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence At least 6 years relevant experience in data science capability development Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or equivalent in computer science, data science, statistics, mathematics, analytics, or related discipline #LI-SSS Pay Transparency and Benefits The stated salary range represents the entire span applicable across all geographic markets from lowest to highest.  Actual salary offers will be determined by multiple factors including but not limited to geographic location, relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and alignment with market data and cost of labor. Dental: with in-network and out-of-network benefit. Vision: with in-network and out-of-network benefit. Wealth: 401(k) with Roth option and matching contribution. Health Savings Account with matching contribution (requires participation in qualifying medical plan). AD&D and supplemental insurance options to help ensure additional protection for you.
